text: hi I'm Matt Turner I'm a software
engineer at tetrate and at this goto
Amsterdam 2023 I'm going to be talking
about making minimal reproducible
declarative container images uh so I'm
going to be using the chain guard
tooling that you might have heard of
appco mange and their Wolfie Linux
distribution so this talk is going to be
very Hands-On very nuts and bolts very
practical uh based on experience I have
of moving some of my own projects from
Locker files to this new tooling the
great stuff about this new tooling is
that it's it's code first driven by Amo
files it's single step it's declarative
it does some constraint satisfaction up
front so you can never end up in a in a
broken place it's faster and all of this
tooling generates you software bills and
materials uh and signatures as we go
along so if you want to come along and
find out how to take your old Docker
file projects and move them to the
latest and greatest tooling around uh
you know making minimal small fast and
lean container images then come and see
my
talk
